data.title: Very outdated and not very clean
data.text: China Doll Restaurant has been around for years.  We used to eat there every time we went to town.  We haven't went for several years but recently decided to stop in.  I do not believe the anything has changed since 1980.  The furniture is outdated and the facility is very uninviting.  That being said, the waitress was very friendly and very prompt.  The atmosphere was fairly quiet.  The food was okay, but not great.  Prices were very reasonable.  I highly doubt I would go back.

data.title: good food
data.text: Since the last time a few years ago the restaurant has improved in cleanliness and food quality. Staying like this or even improving we will stop by again. The food did not have msg and was lightly seasoned. Perfect for us.

data.title: Great Chinese cuisine
data.text: Never had a bad meal here, order the #5, for 2 and still have a lot left to take home. Fresh made and delicious. Wide variety of menu options.

data.title: best Chinese restaurant in town
data.text: I've eaten here for over four decades, never a bad meal, never anything but attentive polite servers, and hands down the best chow mein I've had. In the years that I still drank I often frequented the bar at The China Doll and always found their drinks to be a great value and being able to enjoy a bowl of rice and some prawns with my gin and tonic made it my favorite bar.

data.title: Fly in food
data.text: I have been going there for years--it's my sons favorite place. One day I ordered a lunch combo, which came with soup. When my garlic chicken arrived it had a dead housefly in it. I never even had one bite. I flagged the waitress down and she offered to replace it but I had lost my appetite. When the bill came for my sons meal she's added a charge for an additional cup of soup. I said what's this for?  She said, "Well you at least ate the soup from your meal!"  Really?!  Who does that?  One visit, prior to that, she complained that my eight year old made too many crumbs from his soup and crackers. Stating, "I'll have to get he carpet sweeper now."  My son has to go in weekly for shots and this was his choice for reward....we're done!

data.title: Good food and service
data.text: Hit this place on Sunday after a play. Have been going here for over 30 years. Have tapered off over the past 10 years. Thai food took over my taste drive. For the update . The place has aged. Booths are showing wear and covers are wearing out. Place was painted recently. Black and red. Service was good. Prices were reasonable. and the food was good. Had house combo dinner  Lots of food and a nice variety. Booze prices were good. I would recommend it for a meal or a drink.

data.title: Great Atmosphere
data.text: The food here is just ok.  Nothing exceptional, but the atmosphere is top notch for the most stereotypical old Chinese restaurant style.  I love the dragon on the wall.  All in all its not bad, the staff is excellent.

data.title: Not great
data.text:
We went to China Doll on New Years Eve on advise of a friend. We should have walked out as soon as we walked in but thought we would give it a try anyway. The carpet was filthy, the bench to sit and wait on needed repair currently patched with tape.

Then the food, small amount compared to other Chinese places we have been too. Little taste, mostly bland. Almond chicken was a thin sliver of chicken in breading. Most of plate was warm, the chow mien was hot. 

Not worth another visit.

data.title: Step back in time
data.text:
Both the environment and food are throwbacks to the '50s (although the restaurant opened in the '60s...time passed slowly in downtown Everett, I suppose.)   Having parked our car at the event center, where my son and I were attending an event and cold and hungry, we decided to grab the nearest venue, and the China Doll is directly across the street.  I thought there'd be more dining choices around an event/convention center, but...

We each ordered a combo dinner with pork fried rice, Mongolian beef, sweet and sour pork and almond chicken.  The meal was preceded by egg drop soup, and an appetizer plate with cream cheese wontons, BBQ pork and pot stickers.  The restaurant apparently does a lot of take-out business, so knowing this, we expected, and got, take-out quality.  Decent take-out quality - I've certainly had worse.  We were neither surprised nor disappointed.  

The taste and presentation of the almond chicken took me back to childhood, and was in my opinion, quite tasty.  The Mongolian beef was fine, although it could have used a little more flavor and heat, and a few more pieces of meat.  The sweet and sour pork arrived as expected - crisp rolls of pork with sauce poured over the top.  Nothing special, nothing really to complain about if you set your expectations to "working people's" Chinese food, not gourmet Chinese.  We set our expectations to the appropriate level, and enjoyed our meal.  Service was attentive, the restroom could use freshening, The decor was '50s Chinese restaurant, but not kitschy.  Price was quite reasonable.  We traveled up from Seattle after work, so we elected to skip eating in Seattle, not knowing how traffic might be, and chose to eat in Everett - thus landing at China Doll.

data.title: Typical Chinese Food
data.text: Ordered take-out. The food was alright. Pretty typical Chinese food. The wontons were nothing like I'm used to, not to my liking, but not bad. The general tso's chicken was pretty good. We will continue to look for a better Chinese restaurant.

data.title: inconsistent
data.text: , last time we'll go. The last year or more we have had more bad food than good, the spouse has said never again more than once. Today  was the final straw for even me. Was there shortly after opening instead of lunch special got dinner- no soup, ragoon, etc , the food tasted like vinegar -no fixing it. no discount

data.title: best customer service in town!
data.text: cheap, quick and delicious!  They always make my  dishes a little spicier...which I love!!  GO SEE THEM!!

data.title: Very friendly, affordable and delicious!
data.text: We had just watched a play (Mary Poppins) at the Everett Village Theater and were looking for a Chinese Restaurant to eat at for dinner, so put information in our GPS and feel very lucky to have found this place!  It certainly doesn't look that great from the outside, but oh my!  Such friendly service and affordable, delicious food!  We will make that our stop for dinner the next time we are in Everett for another play.  So worth it!  Give it a try!

data.title: Great service and food! With a full service lounge! DO IT!!
data.text: What you might call a "hole in the wall" location. Clean, friendly, and nostalgic setting. We had a large variety of food and we're happy with the quality, taste and portions. There seems to always be some one to open and greet you at the door with a smile. That is a great form of service that is rare and always welcoming. It makes it seem there is nothing to hide- just come right on in!

data.title: Cantonese Style Chinese Food
data.text: The Northwest seems to mostly have Mandarin style Chinese food. This restaurant is Cantonese style which is very different with very specific recipes without deviation. I grew up on this style of Chinese food and love it! If you've never had Cantonese style it's worth trying. Lots of vegetables in their dishes and doesn't seem to use a lot of oils. My favorite is the Chicken Chow Mein.

data.title: Our "GoTo" Restaurant
data.text: One or twice a month our office gang eats out.  China Doll has always been our "goto" restaurant because the food is delicious and the owner's are the sweetest people on earth.  If you don't believe me, just call and listen to her sweet voice!  I personally love the L2 which is the perfect combination of my favorites, shrimp and almond fried chicken.  It comes served with a yummy fried wonton and a generous helping of fried rice.  My coworker loves the Mongolian Beef.  They are very consistent so if you like them the first time, you will always like them.  We do!

data.title: great food!
data.text: We order take out on a regular basis from The China Doll. The food is always great and everything is always fresh. They have the best pan fried noodles without the drive to China Town. We recently had lunch at the restaurant instead of take out, The service was great. Our food came quickly and was hot and fresh and the portions were large .Great place for Chinese food. They also had a large variety of American food on the menu. .

data.title: Bad food
data.text: Egg rolls that were greasy beer batter blobs with  a hint of mystery filling.  Mongolian beef over cooked veg with zero texture that tasted bad.  I'm hoping this ill feeling goes away.  Don't bother.

data.title: good food for reasonable price
data.text:
plenty of good food, little bit on salty side, but....ok
service quick and friendly. Place clean-average.

data.title: It's so BAD!
data.text: Absolutely horrible. I ate here because of the good tripadvidor reviews, so I wanted to save someone else 30$. Bad, greasy, gritty meat. Its hard to mess up orange chicken, but wow. This was literally the worst Chinese food ive had in my life. The wonton soup is 8$ an order and I couldn't even eat it. I was to suspicious of the meat content... Eggroll you say? Don't even.. It was the size of a torpedo with greasy crust about 2 inches thick. Nothing I purchased here was edible. At all.
